page.title: 20Halifax Railways
page.content: At{HALIFAX STATION}there used to be 4 full platforms and a bay platform but only 2 are used now.Halifax's goods yard could have taken some of the biggest freight trains used today.It is now a carpark.The first passenger service in Calderdale was opened in 1842 from Manchester to Leeds.It went through Normanton,so passengers wishing to go to Halifax had to disembark at Sowerby Bridge.The line as it is now was completed in 1854. From Sowerby Bridge it goes through Halifax and Bradford.Many of the lines were closed down in the 1950's.The only passanger service still in use is the Manchester to Leeds via Halifax.
